reasoning: Lactic acidosis is a metabolic derangement secondary to underlying conditions (sepsis, shock, liver failure, malignancy). Estimated ~8.5 per 100k based on sepsis incidence (1-3 per 100k) with 5-40% developing lactic acidosis, plus other etiologies. Low confidence reflects conceptual heterogeneity: not a primary disease but a clinical manifestation with variable etiology and incidence dependent on underlying condition prevalence.
